alert.note: Alert for Nye (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 11:40PM PDT until September 11 at 2:15AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM PDT SUNDAY FOR NORTHWESTERN NYE COUNTY... At 1140 PM PDT, Light rain showers continue to fall over the warning area. Water within gulleys continue to flow fast with water and the area of Peavine Canyon Road and State Route 376 is still being adversely affected with flash flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Manhattan. Flooding has been reported on Highway 376 between the Manhattan turnoff (Highway 377) and US 6. Other roadways such as Peavine Canyon Road west of Highway 376 may also be flooded. Smaller roads may be washed out or otherwise impassable. Due to the dark conditions, please use extreme caution if driving in the warning location as a washed out road may not been seen at night. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
